intro: Vicia seguenzae, commonly known as the Seguenza vetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial legume that typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its trifoliate leaves are compound, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and hairy. Vicia seguenzae plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
